risks_and_complications: Crown or bridge abutment teeth may require root canal treatment.
Uncomfortable or strange feelings, which is typically temporary.
Muscle soreness or tenderness of the jaw may persist following placement of the prosthesis.
Unsatisfactory longevity of crowns and bridge.
Swelling, jaw muscle tenderness or resultant numbness of the tongue, lips, teeth, jaws and/or facial tissues, which is typically temporary, but in rare instances, may be permanent.
